_header: Knowen all men that are and shall been
_description: ’Carta Dei’ (one form of the ‘Charter of Christ’) — forty-two lines in couplets

BodKentCh233.First Lines:
Knowyn alle men tat arn and schuln benþat U Ihesus of nazaren
                    wyt myn…
BodKentCh233.Last Lines:
…þe ȝer of my regne herThretty wynter and
                    þredde half ȝer
BodKentCh233.Note: At the end: ‘Hec est carta dei’.
BodKentCh233.Editions:
Macray,  William D. 
             “Fifteenth-Century Religious Verses.” 
             Notes and Queries
         9th ser. 8 (1901): 240: 240.
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 97-8.
